params.question: What is a leg in Polymesh?

answers.text: Transactions are bi-pedal and use their legs to move about.
Transaction processing is a journey, subdivided into stages, or legs.
A portion, or step, of an instruction.

params.question: Which of the following is a valid leg description?

answers.text: Alice sends 100 ACME shares from her trading portfolio to Bob's default portfolio.
Alice swaps 100 ACME shares for 100 US dollar tokens.
Alice offers 100 ACME shares at 1 US dollar per share.

params.question: How is double-booking in another instruction's leg be avoided?

answers.text: New instructions can be created only after previous instructions have been settled.
An asset's relevant quantity is committed when the owner affirms a leg.
Assets are frozen while pending instructions exist.
Double-booking is not a concern because affirmed instructions can still fail.

params.question: Thinking of Polymesh's instructions as multiparty transactions, which of these statements are true?

answers.text: Instructions are settled after a majority of the parties agree that it's the right thing to do.
Multiparty transactions are not necessary because everyone acts independently.
An instruction cannot be created without legs, and legs cannot be created outside of instructions.
After it has been created, an instruction cannot be modified.

params.question: Why can an instruction stay in a pending status after it is affirmed by all parties?

answers.text: The instruction will remain in a pending state until ACME's compliance rules are satisfied.
Network consensus will determine if the transaction is allowable.
The transaction will not proceed without regulatory approval.
All parties must also be in good standing with the validators.
That the instructions are always either completely executed or not executed at all.
There is no case or interval when a transaction is partially executed.
The cryptography is designed to repel theorised quantum computer attacks.
The system will operate for 100 years between recharges.
Any small part of the instruction can execute, independent of the others.

params.question: Which of these attributes of a custodial relationship are true?

answers.text: A custodian doesn't own the securities on-chain, the beneficiary still does.
A custodial relationship can not be revoked.
Custodial transfers are semi-privat and surveillance resistent.
Custodians appear as owners on the chain. They are bound to clients by traditional legal structures.

params.question: Does a venue creator control the accounts allowed to affirm instructions in its venue?

answers.text: False
True

params.question: What is a pre-authorisation in Polymesh?

answers.text: A signature that validates at least one future instruction.
A signature that validates any number of future instructions.
A signature that validates exactly one future instruction.
There are no pre-authorisations.

params.question: What are benefits of separating assets into logical portfolios within a single account?

answers.text: Assets across portfolios can have different balances while being connected to the same account.
Permissions can be delegated by portfolio.
Custody can be granted by portfolio.
Asset partitioning into logical portfolios facilitates good asset management.

params.question: What does beneficial ownership mean in Polymesh?

answers.text: The benefits of ownership can be severed from actual ownership and traded separately.
Beneficial ownership is always held by the beneficiary's account and is the base criteria to participate in corporate actions.
There is no beneficial ownership. There is only ownership.
It's like regular ownership, but with benefits.
